oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Account of pay for Major General Benjamin Franklin Cheatham

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Missionary Ridge (Tenn. and Ga.); Payment; Payrolls
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Certificate of payment for Confederate Major General B. F. Cheatham for services from June 1 to July 1, 1863, for a total of $300.00. Signed by M. B. Pilcherd, Captain and Assistant Quartermaster, Paymaster in Cheatham's Division.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Confederate States of America -- Quartermaster General's Office
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Quartermaster of the Army provides logistical support to the combat troops in the form of ammunition, clothing, food, and pay. The Battle of Missionary Ridge took place in November 1863 and resulted in a Union victory. One of the final battles of the federal Chattanooga campaign, it expelled the Confederates from the Chattanooga area. This was Ulysses S. Grant's final battle before his promotion to commander of federal forces in March 1864.
